intro: Lophoschoenus, commonly known as the spikegrass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical inflorescences that resemble spikes, which are typically composed of dense clusters of small, spikelet-like flowers. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to Australia and are often found in wetland or swampy habitats. Lophoschoenus plants are perennial and have rhizomatous growth, allowing them to spread and form dense stands. Their botanical features make them important components of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
